quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [cell phone rings] Hello, this is Dwight Schrute. [phone keeps ringing] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [presses button on headset] Hello, this is Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hello? Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, we do have that. Hold on one second...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And how many would you like?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Uh, uh, hang that up right now. Ha-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Absolutely. We can get that out to you immediately.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [into Jim's headset] This man is an imposter! Do not do business with him! This is not Dwight Schrute!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight left his cell phone on his desk. So, naturally, I paired it to my headset.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [cell phone rings] K, fine. I'll just let it go to voicemail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [presses button on headset] Hello, this is Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, is this Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh my goodness, you sound sexy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, thank you. I've been working out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Woah, woah, woah, Pam!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Have you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam! You are not talking to Dwight right now. You are talking to Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! [waves arms] Pam, I'm over here!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm confused...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Disconnect that right now. You give me your earpiece.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Can't do that. Unsanitary.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ugh! Okay, you know what? Fine. I will reprogram my phone to go to my office phone. [presses buttons on his cell phone] Done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [office phone rings at Jim's desk] This is Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, and I forwarded his desk phone to mine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, hello Mater. Good news: I've married. Tell Fater. [hangs up] Such a nice woman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [slams cell phone on desk] Argh! Ahh!!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Today is Toby Flenderson's last day. I couldn't sleep last night. I came extra-early. So much energy... There are certain days you know you know you will remember for the rest of your life, and I just have a feeling that today is one of those days.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mornin'. [to camera] So here we go, just a matter of hours now, until his horribleness has left the building. I'm going to set my watch alarm... And... [watch beeps]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Good morning, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I can't believe this is your last day. How do you feel?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Fine. Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I feel weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: First thing on the agenda-actually, the only thing on the agenda, is the status of Toby's going away party.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: We have a buttercream cake and a slideshow of Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But so far we only have two pictures of him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, well, this will not do. Toby is going away forever, and uh, we need to do something very very special. In some cultures, when somebody leaves, like New Orleans culture, they have a parade and they have a band and people party in the streets...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Do you mean, leaves as in dies? You want us to throw Toby a New Orleans' funeral?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If the Devil were to explode, and evil were gone forever, what sort of party would you have?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Like a beach blowout? Or a toga, toga-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. You know-no!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toga!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You always do this! We have a nice, modest party planned, and then you come in and demand the world. Let me be clear. There is simply no money for anything other than a cake and to develop a few more slides... although Toby won't be in them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I thought that you might say that. [takes off his shoe; hums; takes out cash from shoe]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Every year, my sweet, sweet grandmother sends me a check on my birthday for fifty dollars. And lately, she has been sending me, like nine or ten checks a year... uh, as Nana starts to... but, I knew I should be saving it for something, I just didn't know what I should be saving it for. And then I had an awakening. "Michael, buy a motorcycle." So I put the money in my shoe, and then I forgot about it until now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I want a party that makes me feel like I am flying through the air without this... ugly weight holding me down, you know?... I want an antigravity machine. I saw it in a movie. You drink a potion, and then you just start floating all around.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So how much antigravity potion do you want?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No! No! You know what? This is not a party-planning committee anymore! And I don't want your foot money, and I feel uncomfortable participating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Phyllis, can you do this?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [whispers] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi, can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hi. Yes, uh, I'm Holly Flax. I was told to ask for a Mr. Flenderson?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: As part of my last day I'm training the new Human Resources rep in the ways of the company. Again, the company has allotted for this training-one day.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: So this is H.R. This is your desk.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: I love the view.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, it's great, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey. [kisses Jim on cheek]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey... What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Guess who just got into the Pratt School of Design.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No way! What did I say? I said that they'd love those sketches. Congratulations!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, thank you! I don't know why I doubted it, because I'm so clearly awesome!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes! So when do you start?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know, I didn't read it carefully, I just saw "congratulations" and I skimmed the list, I saw my name, I came in here to tell you and get a snack.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. Busy morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, you know it means I have to go to New York for three months...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's not a big deal. I'll come visit you. And you'll visit me. It's only two hours away. It'll be fine. That part's gonna suck, but it'll be great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, it sucks, but it'll be great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: See how easy that is?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ohh... [they hug; she laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I wouldn't go if things weren't so solid with Jim. And down the road, if we have a family, I couldn't go then either. So, the timing's perfect... And that is the first time I've ever used the word "perfect" in here!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, Stanley...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I want to introduce you to...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [watching from his office] Toby's replacement. Ugh. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So what do we know about her?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, we know that Toby thinks she'll be great. So, strike one, I hate her already.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I hate her too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why do you hate her?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Because she... stinks... with her... ways... and her... head.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, Dwight, sometimes... I don't know, I think you say things just to agree with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Would that be such a bad thing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah! It would! Just have a thought. Have an original thought. Although, I will agree that her head is weird. You know what we need to do?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We need to sell her an elevator pass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: But our, our elevator doesn't require a pa... [gasps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Exactly. A little old-fashioned hazing.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hi. Are there any local companies that rent antigravity machines?

quotes.speaker: Woman over speakerphone
quotes.line: Antigravity machines?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: That's right. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Woman over speakerphone
quotes.line: What do they do exactly?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: They make you feel lighter...

quotes.speaker: Woman over speakerphone
quotes.line: Antigravity... Um... Anti...depressants? I could put you through to someone on that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [knock on door] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, hey, do you still work here?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'd like to introduce you to my replacement.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. I think I will pass.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael Scott, this is Holly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi. Yeah. Right. Okay, well, they hired a female Toby. Good for the world. Thank you, God, for creating two of you. Here's how things work here: my job is to make the office fun. Your job is to make the office lame. And we have an eternal struggle, you and I. And only one of us can be the winner. Spoiler alert: I'm gonna win.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Man, someone doesn't like H.R.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [to Toby] What did you do to him?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: T-No. He tortured me... with his awfulness.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yeah, I know what you mean. I nearly fell asleep when he gave me a tour of the files. Um, well look, I'll let you get back to work, but I-I really look forward to working with you, Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Y-You can-Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thanks to Toby, I have a very strong prejudice against Human Resources. I believe that the department is a breeding ground for monsters. What I failed to consider though, is that not all monsters are bad. Like E.T. Is Holly our extraterrestrial? Maybe. Or maybe she's just an awesome woman from this planet.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [shaking Holly's hand] The pleasure's all mine.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, thanks. I'm really looking forward to sitting down with you and finding out more about what you do here.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Any time.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: What do you do here?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: ...Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: What is wrong with this woman? She's asking about stuff that's nobody's business. "What do I do?"... Really, what do I do here? I should've written it down. "Qua" something, uh... qua... quar... quibo, qual...quir-quabity. Quabity assuance! No. No, no, no, no, but I'm getting close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [whispering] Have you been introduced to Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: No. Which one's Kevin? [they glance over at Kevin subtly, who is stifling a giggle]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He's here on a special work program. He's slow, you know, in his brain.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh. Good for you guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hazing is a fun way to show a new employee that she is not welcome or liked.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Accounting department, listen up. Holly, Human Resources. Angela, Oscar, and Kevin. [accountants mumble hellos]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hello. Hello. [to Kevin] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: What do you do?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I do the numbers.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, good for you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Do you want a M&M?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, no, that is so sweet. But thank you though.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. I keep them here at my desk so that everybody doesn't take them.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Well that is a very safe place for them.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Here she is! Holly... You know, if we hung Holly from the ceiling, we'd have to kiss underneath of her. So-I know. Oh, sorry. Question, are you real, or are you a Hollygram?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh... [laughs along] Nice, I've never heard that one before actually.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I bet.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: That's good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I bet. Are these guys boring your ears off?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: No, no, I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh... What, um, what is your commute like? How long does it take to get in?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Ooh, uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, I should make you a mix. Do you have a, uh, a CD player?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Um... Y-yeah. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Do you like it? It's a photo of everyone in the office. So you can take it to Costa Rica.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You're-you're not in it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well I was taking the picture.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I love it. I love it... I would love a picture of the two of us, to also take to Costa Rica.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure, do you have a camera here?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No, uh... [shouts] Does anyone have a camera here? [no one answers him] No one has a camera here. Uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm gonna... I'll go get one. Stay. [runs out of the office]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on the phone] So I just got the fax closing the sale, and uh, it's big. It is really big.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Congratulations!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Don't interrupt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I just-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Congratulations on doing your job. Did you enter the sale on the website?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I didn't. I just logged it in right here, so...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: All right, try to be a team player here, Jim. Log it in the website.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, well it already went through, so...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Don't worry about that. Just re-log it. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [listening to "Crash Into Me" on his computer] Hmm... Jim? [Jim comes into his office] I am downloading some N3P...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's not it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Music...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: For a CD mix tape...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: For Holly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And I'm looking for perfect songs that work on two levels.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What are the two levels?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The two levels being, uh, "Welcome to Scranton"...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And "I... love you."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. Let's start with the "I love you" level.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, what's the group that was from Scranton that made it big? Was that U2?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes. You don't love Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But you just met her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, it was love at first sight. Actually, it was-no, it was when I heard her voice. It was love at first see with my ears.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, okay, it doesn't work like that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, you're not a romantic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Actually, I think I am. And I have a little bit of experience in office romance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Like, with who?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We've been through this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, we are still dating. And guess what? I took it slow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, you took it too slow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, we're really happy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This thing with Holly feels a lot like love to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And that's really sweet. And you can think that. But you don't say that out loud, and you definitely don't say it to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't want her to get away.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know. Here, Michael, you can court her as you get to know her, you know? I mean, the office is a great place for that. Pam and I, we got to know each other right out there. I mean, the first time we joked around was at my desk. And the first meal we ever had was, in the break room, actually. We were at two separate tables and, I remember that. The first time we kissed even, was right outside, and... Look, all I'm saying is that you can get to know someone really really well, like I did, right here at work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I was thinking... fireworks for the party. What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh boy. I appreciate your help, but I can't...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, no, no, no, no, no. I just meant I wanted to pay to have fireworks at the party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Why would you do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because I'm gonna miss Toby. Yep, he's a heck of a guy, and I think we should send him off right. It doesn't matter. Here ya go. [hands her an envelope with money in it]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well we all want a good party, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm going to propose tonight. Holy crap!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hey Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Do you need some help?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I can't decide what to get.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Well, what do you like to eat?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Well I like pretzels, but, I really like chips.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hmm. Well how much money do you have there? [looks at the change in his hand] Okay, let's see... fifty... Oh, this is a button. Okay. Fifty-five, sixty-five, okay, you have seventy-five cents. So, that means you could get anything up in the top row.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm totally gonna bang Holly! She is cute, and helpful, and she really seems into me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on phone, leaving a message] Hey, Ryan, it's Jim. Look man, I don't know what's gotten into you lately, but you know what? I really don't care, because you're trying to get rid of me. And I bet you don't think I care enough about this job to actually fight back, but you're wrong, because I do, and I will. So you can keep trying to push me out of this place, but guess what? I'm not going anywhere. [hangs up and exhales sharply]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [tool clicking] Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello, Holly. [Holly is on the floor with her desk chair in pieces] Woah, what are you doing? You don't, uh, you don't have to do that. I mean, we have already put-together chairs. That's how we buy them actually.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, I'm trying to adjust the lumbar support on Toby's chair and... that made this up/down lever thing not work, and then I took the whole chair apart, and that... is the story of me on the floor. It's pretty good, right? You know, I'm gonna sell the movie rights.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And the sequel, "Woman Stands at Desk and Works." So, I have no idea how you, [he sits on the floor] how you sit like that.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yoga.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [as Yoda] Sit on floor and put together chair we will. [laughs nervously] Yo-da. Um...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [as Yoda] Pass curvy metal piece, you will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So are you in down this weekend? Cause, I'm not-I'm not... I'm not gonna be in town. I'm going out of town.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Ohh, so you can't make my orgy? Kidding!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Kidding. [overdramatically] Acting!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [overdramatically] Acting!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [overdramatically] Acting!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [laughs] Lovitz.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I did it! [exhales]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What'd you do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I talked to her-Holly. Just pleasantries, nothing, you know... not like, do you want kids or, religion, or what side of the bed do you want. Hey, I can take either side of the bed at this point.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. Okay, so how'd that feel?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It was hard. I wanted to kiss her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I'm so glad you didn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whew, oh God. [inhales] Laying a base. Laying a base...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There you go. There's plenty of base-laying left, right?... Hey. Hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [giddy] Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hello Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Phyllis, you look like you're gonna have a heart attack.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Can I get a list of your vendors?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I shredded it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Why would you do that?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Gosh, I just don't know. Why do you think?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [knocks files off desk] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [Michael and Holly are still working on the chair] What'd you guys do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, there he is. Thought you had gone home already. Why don't you go home, and come back for the party?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, we still have to do the exit interview.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes we do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'll let you in on a little secret: I've been very much looking forward to this moment. Very, very much. I-I have been steeped in anticipation. Toby has been cruisin' for a bruisin' for twelve years, and I am now his cruise director, and my name is Captain Bruisin'.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [Michael hands him a present] Wow, thanks, Michael, I...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Can I just say that, of all the idiots, in all the idiot villages, in all the idiot worlds, you stand alone, my friend.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: [enters conference room] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! Hi, good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: You too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm just having a little exit interview.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yeah, I know, that's why I'm here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, no, no, no. This is very boring stuff. Why don't you take a tour? Have you seen the baler?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: No, no, I'll look at it later. It's part of my job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [enters conference room] Did you need me to take notes?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hi Pam. Stay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um... Alright, well then, I will proceed. [takes out note cards] I just have some questions that I was gonna ask. Um... Who do you think you are?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Correct. Um... What gives-what-what gives you the right?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Um, I-I brought the binder. Do you wanna take a little look?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure. You know what? That sounds good. I'll take a little look-see.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you. [reads] What would you improve about Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This place, um...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, no no no no no...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I've got some ideas, I guess...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No no no no no. I'm not asking it. I'm just reading it out loud.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, I'd like to hear the answer.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well let me see... I would, uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [hides his face from Holly; whispers to Toby] I'll kill you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I guess everything's okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I made it this far, right? What's the point?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Toby, why don't you open your present?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, no no no, no, no. No, this-hey, hey, hey, hey, this might not be what I think... that I don't even know is in there, because there are a lot of presents in my car, and I don't know which is which...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [unwraps present; present is a rock with a Post-It note rubber-banded to it; reads] "Suck on this."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What the hell is that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's... What do you mean, "Michael"? That's not even my handwriting. [exits conference room] Hey! What the hell is going on here?! Who thought it would be hysterical to give Toby a rock for his going-away gift?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You did.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You made me wrap it. I thought it was over the line. I just- [Michael slams conference room door in his face]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, you know what that is? You know what that is? That is... a psyche. Psyche. So, that is not my real gift to Toby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So what is your gift?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: My gift is forthcoming, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am going to give Toby...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Your watch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...Yes, I am. That was it. How did you know that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I just knew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How did you know?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh that is so sweet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well... That's my watch.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Thanks, I'm gonna set it to Costa Rica time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, that's good.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [from outside the conference room] Hey, it's the kid! Look, look, look, look, look! [Michael, Toby, Holly, and Pam exit the conference room] Hey! It's the temp! Look! [everyone is crowded around Jim's computer]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh my gosh.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: It's the temp! [all are watching a YouTube video of Ryan being escorted out of Dunder Mifflin corporate offices by policemen]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is that the police?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well this is what happened: uh, Ryan's big project was the website... which wasn't doing so well. So Ryan, to give the impression of sales, recorded them twice: once as office sales, once as website sales. Which is what we refer to in the business as "misleading the shareholders." Another good term is "fraud." The real crime, I think, was the beard.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [still watching video of Ryan] Oh my God. Ryan... Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I cannot wait to visit Ryan in prison. I'm gonna wear my hottest track suit, and get my hair done, and then be like, "Hi Ryan." And then all the other prisoners are gonna be like, "Damn! Ryan, you got a hot ex-girlfriend. Ooh, I would never have treated her so bad when I was outside of prison."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Would you do me a favor and connect me to Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Absolutely. [dials and hands Jim receiver]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [clears throat] Right to voicemail. [into phone] Hey, Ryan, it's Jim. You know what? Totally disregard that last voicemail, because you obviously have your hands tied. Good luck! [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: What's protocol on this?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I normally do nothing, I guess. No, you shouldn't- [Holly knocks on Michael's door]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Michael, are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [voice straining] I'm just worried about my friend.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, of course you are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just, I'm fine. I'm holding it together. I-I have a business to run.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: No, hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm cool.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Stop. You can let yourself be upset. He's your friend. You know what I usually find?...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Holly is sweet and simple, like a lady baker. I would not be surprised to find out that she had worked in a bakery before coming here. She has that kind of warmth. I'm pretty sure she's baked on a professional level.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [everyone exits the building to find a carnival-themed party in the parking lot] Woah! Cool! A bouncy house!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Kevin, take your shoes off first!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No antigravity machine, huh?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Sorry, Michael, I don't think they're real.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ferris wheel's pretty cool though.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow. Look at our parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, who'd have thought? [Pam sees fireworks being set up; smiles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is Jim gonna propose tonight? He is, isn't he? No, he's not... Is he?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, it was a pretty good company, but I just couldn't see a future there. They kept hiring from the outside. It was easy to get in but impossible to rise up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what she... a lot of places are like that.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: I think it's really cool you hired Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You have it?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Almost. [she unlocks Holly's car]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, here we go. Here we go. [Mose carries a raccoon in a cage] Put it in. [he puts the raccoon in the car]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I like, uh...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: That-That's my car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Mose drops cage and runs] Mose!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What the hell is going on here?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: N-nothing you need to know the details of.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: There is a raccoon in the car, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: N-no there's not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why did you do that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It was playful hazing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. There is no such thing as playful hazing. Dwight, I want you to look at Holly right now. Everybody, I want you to look at Holly right now, and maybe if you look at her deeply enough, you will see what I see in her. And that is that we are all very lucky to have her here. Holly is the best thing that has happened to this company since World War II. Fifty years, she is the best. [to Dwight] Take care of that, all right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's not rabid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Shh...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Thanks for bringing that up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get it out. Come on, get it out. Get it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm really sorry.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Michael, thank you so much for saying that. [puts a hand on his arm] I feel so welcome here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: I just... Um, excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Did you see that! Did you see it? Did you see what... wow-wee! Uh, well, Jan didn't believe in showing affection, so... sometimes I don't know how to react when a girl touches me. Oh... I like it! [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Vance Refrigeration Guy
quotes.line: Hey Mrs. Vance, we're all out!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey, Kev, I need you to do me a solid and go buy some more barbeque sauce. [Kevin nods] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Cool! You drive your own car?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yup. This is my car. Do you drive your own car?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yep. Just like you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Okay, bye.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Bye. Kevin, I'm really proud of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on microphone] Alright! Let's hear it for Darryl and his band. [applause] You know what? Let's also give a shout-out to Phyllis for this awesome party, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [everyone applauds] Yay, Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Probably the best one that we have ever had, right? [cheers and applause] But the real reason that we are here, is to say goodbye to a guy who we will probably never ever see again. Now, a lot of you know that I am an accomplished songwriter.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Song parody writer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have done things like um, "Beers in Heaven."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Classic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Or, "Total Eclipse of the Fart."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not my favorite, but...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I like that one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's not my favorite...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I like that one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love to sing them, but I am not going to be doing that today. I am going to be doing something I wrote specifically for Toby. [to band] Do you know, um, "Goodbye Stranger"? Supertramp?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah. [music starts]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [sings] It was early morning yesterday... I was up before the dawn... and I really have enjoyed my stay... Toby must be movin' on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm gonna to miss Toby. He has a nice, calming presence in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [singing] Goodbye Toby, it's been nice. Hope you find your paradise...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Don't tell him I said this, but I always thought he was kinda cute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [singing, screaming into the mic] Come tomorrow, feel no pain! Feel no pain! Toby! Toby! Tobee-yy! Toby's goin' away! See ya! He's outta here! See ya! He's outta here! Ohh! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Tooo-by!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Not bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, hey. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Someday I would love to hear "Beers in Heaven."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, okay. Yeah. Well, actu-too soon. It's uh, it's uh, very sexual. [cell phone rings] Sorry. Kevin. [answers] Kevin, where are you? You missed my song, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, Michael, I'm at Gerrity's. You have to come down here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Just pay for it and we'll reimburse you when you get back.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, I-I brought my money. Michael, there's something that you need to see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Just hurry. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Is he okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. He's at the supermarket and he needs me.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yeah well, the party, driving to the supermarket... it's a big day for him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, that's true. Don't move a muscle. I will be back momentarily, all right? [Holly freezes; Michael laughs] No, you can drink-you can finish your drink and then I'll-okay, I'll be back.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Well it was good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: It was great to see you, Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yeah, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: O-kay. Hello Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Hello... Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow, Kevin, really? We're- [to Jan] Sorry. We're in the middle of a party. [to Kevin] Is this why you called me down here?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, Michael, I just uh...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I think you kids have a lot to catch up on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thanks, Kevin. Um... [Kevin walks away, revealing Jan's pregnant belly]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow. I can't believe it! Look at you! [Jan laughs] Are you nauseous?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you-do you have cravings? You never touched my Propecea, or my Accutane, did you?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good. Good. Thank God.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I didn't...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Cause that's...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ... touch that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow, I am so happy. I am so deliriously happy...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because you're pregnant, and because it obviously happened when we were together. And, I am very...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yeah, it did...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ... proud.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ... happen when...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ... we were together. That's true. And-but, you... are not... uh, you're not the dad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You cheated on me... when I specifically asked you not to?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: ...Not to. No, I did not. I did not cheat on you.  I did not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, okay...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So it's mine, and it's not somebody else's, so... I know... the whole toilet seat thing is a myth, so...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I went to a sperm bank.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You did?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yuh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: When we were going out?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Uh, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: W-I don't understand. You always used to be very cautious... I'd wear two condoms.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You'd rather have somebody else's sperm than my sperm?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No, no no... it's not just any sperm bank. I mean, it's really... this is a really, really great place. It's amazing, actually. I'm gonna bring you the catalogue. You should look through it. It's... and it's-in fact, it's right next to that little breakfast place that you like in the city where you can draw on the tables.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: IHop.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: IHop.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: If I was 22, and I had lots of time to have lots of children, then sure, let's let Michael have a shot at one of 'em. But, honestly, I need to make this one count.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Oh, that's really good. I feel so much better. I just needed to get all that out onto the table.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm glad you told me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Look, I don't know what you're gonna be doing tomorrow, but I have my Lamaze class in Allentown, and um... you could come. I usually, you know, use a foam noodle instead of a partner...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, I'll... I have to think about it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: My whole life, I have known two things: I love sex, and I want to have kids. And I always thought that those two things would go hand in hand, but now, I think it might be one or the other.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh look, they're starting. [all watch fireworks display; scattered applause and cheers; Darryl's band plays soft music]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [to Phyllis] Well, I hope you had fun today, because you're never ever throwing a party again.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [gets engagement ring from his pocket] Hey...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on microphone] Can I have your attention please? [music stops] I was waiting for the right time to do this, and I can't think of a better time than right now, with the music playing, and all our friends around, and fireworks going off... My parents are here! Andrew and Ellen Bernard. Thank you for sharing in this joyous moment. Miss Angela Martin, will you please join me onstage? [Angela shakes her head 'no'] Okay, then I will come to you, my flower. [knocks over Darryl's keyboard]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Unh! Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Angela, will you do me the honor... of giving me your tiny hand in marriage? [shows her a ring]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: ...Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Into the mic, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I said, okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: She said yes! [light applause] And the crowd goes wild! Woo! [music starts playing; Jim puts his ring back in his pocket and exhales sharply]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I've been carrying that ring around in my wallet for six years. Because you don't know when you're gonna meet the right girl and the moment's gonna be right. And tonight, with the fireworks, and the music, and everything... it was right.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Can I be your bridesmaid?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well... it's my own fault.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Tuna! [hugs Jim; makes small explosion sound] I'm engaged!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know. That's awesome, man. That's great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Mr. Andrew Bernard... it's got a nice ring to it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey. Hey, you know, I just realized uh, I don't have a picture of the two of us.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, um...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, could we...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure. Meredith, do you mind?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [hands Meredith his camera] This one right here.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Okay. One two three- [takes picture] Oh let's do it again. Pam your smile is weird.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's digital, so just take as many as you want.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: One, two three- [takes picture] One, two, three- [takes picture]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know, I just, I really thought Jim was gonna propose tonight...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Hey there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: So you missed something really big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yeah, Andy proposed to one of your accountants.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, wow.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: I'm not so specific as I can be on my first day, but...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, I can see Andy proposing to Angela. I can also see him proposing to Oscar. [they chuckle] Oh...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: So... You know, somehow after all those ribs, I'm still really hungry. I don't know, I was thinking of maybe going off-campus somewhere, getting some dessert, or...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, um, well, you know what? You should go to the Glider Diner. Ask Stanley about that. Practically lives there.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'll go to the diner with you.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh that would be great.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, we can go eat pie.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: I love pie.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Me too.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Have a good night.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Okay. Good night.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Yeah, it was a good day. I mean, first days are always the hardest, right? Well, I should go. [Kevin is waiting in the car] I gotta buckle him in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well this is it. I am here to see you off.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Thanks... [Hank is standing next to Michael] Really, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sorry. Corporate policy.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You might take something.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: I don't think he's gonna take anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, security guard.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [watch that Michael gave him beeps] Oh, some kind of... alarm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on phone, leaving a message] Hi, Jan, it's Michael. I just um, I just want to let you know that I am going to go to your Lamaze class tomorrow. Um, and if there's any details you need to fill me in on, like... what exactly Lamaze is, that would be great. And I... will see you tomorrow morning. [hangs up] I am going to be... kind of a daddy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Party planning's a real high. Like a runner's high. [gets out of elevator; hears moans and heavy breathing coming from office; opens door and sees Dwight and Angela making out]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [sees Phyllis; gasps] Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What? [turns and sees Phyllis; Phyllis gasps and drops the box in her hands]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This is Jim Halpert...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: And Pam Beesly.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, Pam!  Toby says such nice things about you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [to Toby] Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: He didn't mention me, did he?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, no, he said you were a really good salesman.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks, Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I've always gotten along well with Toby.  Uh, we're friends.  But I don't think we'll stay in touch necessarily.  I think I'll probably get updates on him from Pam.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, I think that makes us neighbors.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: It's a couple streets over.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Oh, maybe you can show me some of the fun hangouts, and where to get my nails done.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sure!  That sounds fun!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: I hate that bitch.  I wanna cut her face. [Dwight walks by and hears]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stop!  Don't look at me.  On the counter you will find bread, peanut butter, and jelly.  Pretend to make yourself a sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Pretend?  Or really make one?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really make one.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Make your own [bleep]in' sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Will you please?  Make a sandwich.  Now, according to my sources, you have an issue with the new H.R. woman.  Well, so do I.  And so does our secret benefactor.  That's too much peanut butter.  What I propose is a good old-fashioned hazing, and I need your help.  If you choose to accept this mission...Wipe the knife off before you stick it in the jelly.  Have you ever made a sandwich before?  Dammit, Meredith!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [on phone] Well, who can do a party of this size?  But you're in the business, you must surely know of some other businesses.  Okay, well, I JUST WANT A DAMN DANCE FLOOR!  Sorry. So sorry, I shouldn't have sworn, I'm so sorry.  Um, thanks for your time. [knock on door]  What?  Sorry, I shouldn't have said 'what' like that, it was really rude.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Scared me.  How's the party planning going?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Jim, I am so f[bleep]ed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So it's going great, sounds like.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I don't know, I'm not used to the stress.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: When I was growing up, my mom said, "the sky's the limit."  I could do anything.  Be a teacher's aide, nurse's assistant, some kind of volunteer.  But now, I, I'm not so sure.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This is a picture I've been carrying around in my wallet for about six years.  It's this unspoiled beach in Costa Rica, Playa Grande.  Um, I take it out when I get stressed or depressed, and it really calms me down.  Never thought I'd get to live here, you know.  But it turns out they built these great new condos there, so, this could be me, right around, uh, where the trees used to be.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Did you just buy that?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, I guess it will be my, uh, thing in Costa Rica, be a nature photographer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's cool.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah. Um, you mind if I get a picture?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Think you could...[wants to hand the camera to Jim, but Jim is starting to snuggle up with Pam, posing.  Toby aims the camera, the flash pops up] Okay. [takes picture] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good one? [Toby puts on the lens cover and scurries away awkwardly] That's a cool camera.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, this is the second time in two days that the website isn't working.  Do you guys know anything about it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The website is hiding, forming alliances with other sites, preparing an attack for which we will have no defense.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you honestly believe that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes, I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm gonna get a second opinion.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It was down for a couple hours yesterday, then back up, and now I've heard from a very reliable source that it is once again out of commission.  And that reliable source is you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, you could just say you don't know what's going on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Um, I do, 'cause I just told you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is Ryan gonna fire me?  I don't know.  I know that I've done everything I can, and I just brought in a huge sale, and... am I insane, or was this kid a temp two years ago?  Because in the three years that he's been here, I think all he's ever done is start a fire and grow a beard.  And it's not even a good beard.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: Troy Undercook, for Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ahh!  I'm sorry, I didn't, I didn't see you come in.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Troy!  What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: Just filling in for Ryan, as a favor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where is Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: He had an urgent matter in New York.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Welcome to our land.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight. [to Troy] Michael will be out in a second.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can I get you a tankard of mead?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Troy, can you do me a huge favor?  Next time you see Ryan, can you tell him to check his messages?  That'd be great.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: If I see him, I'll tell him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Why wouldn't you see him?  You work for him.

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: I report to Wallace now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Looks serious.

quotes.speaker: Someone
quotes.line: What's a...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Troy, do you know anything about this?

quotes.speaker: Troy
quotes.line: Maybe I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Maybe I do.  Enough of your magical riddles!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: And if the food stations are here and here... no!  Here and here.  Drinks here, then people can mingle.  But then where would the band go?

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.line: Mmm.  Well, what about there?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Mmm, no Bob, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: It's times like these, I wish my mother were with me right now.  She'd show me what to do.  That's stupid; she's not here.  [looks at watch] She's at water aerobics for the next forty-five minutes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Why don't we eat more corn dogs?  They're delicious.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Totally, they're the best.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Corn dogs should be the standard.  Corn dogs should be called hot dogs, and hot dogs should be called bad dogs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Why don't we make corn burgers?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [chuckling] What a messed up world.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Seriously, do you like my idea?  Corn burgers.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I need you to make an announcement that this party is a disaster.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: But I don't think it's a disaster.  I think it's fun, and I like the food.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Deep fried Twinkies?  It's gross!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Is that what that is?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know what, I didn't try those. [reaches for one] I could try this.  Augh!  Fried Twinkies, you kidding me?  Starting to wonder about the food in this place [takes a bite].  Oh, God!  That is so good.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: When I had my colitis, Toby was very helpful.  He gave me seven weeks off.  When I had my acid reflux, Toby was not as helpful.  So I'm mixed on Toby.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toby Flenderson, come on up here.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Uh, no, that's okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Co-workers
quotes.line: Toby! Come on, Toby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toby!

quotes.speaker: Co-workers
quotes.line: Toby! Toby! Toby!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Okay, okay, I'm going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Toby has written a fantastic speech for you, he spent a year on it.  It's very funny and charming and heartwarming.  And it rhymes, and if it's not any good, he has instructed us all to storm the stage and beat him to a bloody pulp.  [laughs] No!  So, take it away, Toby!  Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, uh, okay. Um.  It's really great to be here tonight, with the Ferris wheel, the band, and the low sunlight.  I'm gonna miss you all when I go to Costa Rica, and if I keep drinking beer like this, I'm gonna have to take a leak-a. [laughter from audience, Michael looks at camera unhappily]  Look, on a more personal note, I just want to say thanks, you know, no matter what was going on in my life, you know, my divorce, or the custody battle, or that thing with my sister, it was just nice knowing I had a, a supportive place to come to where...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ach, [to Darryl quietly] okay, okay, play the cutoff music.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm gonna really miss going to beers with you guys every Tuesday night [Pam holds up soda in salute, Meredith yells 'yeah!', Michael looks at camera] and lastly, I'd love to urge you to keep up with my fight to have the building checked for radon gas.  You know, it's a, it's a real serious matter, and every time I try to have the, uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Blah, blah, blah, blah...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...building looked into...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...blah, blah, overstaying your welcome!  Let's keep it moving!  Let's keep it moving!  Toby, everybody!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I gave Toby my buddy Jorge's number in Costa.  He'll hook Toby up with everything: cable TV, women, oh, and this amazing coffee to snort.
